channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: They were promised a lifeline to 'graduate' from poverty. Then it was taken away
item.description: Thousands of South Sudanese refugees and impoverished locals in Uganda saw a brighter future with a new USAID-funded project. They'd get $205 and coaching to build a business. Then came the cuts.
item.content:encoded:
Thousands of South Sudanese refugees and impoverished locals in Uganda saw a brighter future with a new USAID-funded project. They'd get $205 and coaching to build a business. Then came the cuts.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: The time change is a chance to reset your sleep schedule – especially for teens
item.description: Wondering how to help a teen get better sleep? This weekend's time change can be a boost. Here's why. Plus tips from sleep doctors to get more zzzs.
item.content:encoded: Wondering how to help a teen get better sleep? This weekend's time change can be a boost. Here's why. Plus tips from sleep doctors to get more zzzs.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: The declining population will make it even harder to care for elders
item.description: Declining population means caring for parents, grandparents, and other relatives could become even more challenging with fewer professionals and family members to pitch in.
item.content:encoded:
Declining population means caring for parents, grandparents, and other relatives could become even more challenging with fewer professionals and family members to pitch in.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Mamdani's youth support goes beyond New York. For many, he's now a national leader
item.description: Zohran Mamdani's focus on affordability concerns has energized many young voters around the country, who say he speaks to some of their most pressing economic concerns.
item.content:encoded:
Zohran Mamdani's focus on affordability concerns has energized many young voters around the country, who say he speaks to some of their most pressing economic concerns.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Trump is leaning into his crackdown on city crime. The GOP sees it as a winning issue
item.description: While previous deployments to Democratic-led cities have largely led to protests and lawsuits, Trump is banking on the moves helping him and Republicans, especially in next year's midterms.
item.content:encoded:
While previous deployments to Democratic-led cities have largely led to protests and lawsuits, Trump is banking on the moves helping him and Republicans, especially in next year's midterms.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Smith's homer in 11th lifts Dodgers over Blue Jays 5-4 to become first repeat champion in 25 years
item.description: In a World Series for the ages that went back and forth again and again, Will Smith delivered the biggest swing of all for the Los Angeles Dodgers.
item.content:encoded:
In a World Series for the ages that went back and forth again and again, Will Smith delivered the biggest swing of all for the Los Angeles Dodgers.

(Image credit: Brynn Anderson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: UK police detain 2 suspects after train stabbings leave 9 people with life-threatening injuries
item.description: British police said 10 people have been hospitalized, nine with life-threatening injuries, following a mass stabbing attack on a London-bound train Saturday evening, and that counter-terrorism police are supporting the investigation.
item.content:encoded:
British police said 10 people have been hospitalized, nine with life-threatening injuries, following a mass stabbing attack on a London-bound train Saturday evening, and that counter-terrorism police are supporting the investigation.

(Image credit: Chris Radburn)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: US carries out new strike in Caribbean, killing 3 alleged drug smugglers
item.description: The U.S. military has carried out another lethal strike on alleged drug smugglers in the Caribbean Sea.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. military has carried out another lethal strike on alleged drug smugglers in the Caribbean Sea.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Daylight saving time ends Sunday. Here's what to know
item.description: Love it or hate it, many will turn their clocks back on Sunday. The debate — whether or not to make daylight saving time permanent — continues.
item.content:encoded:
Love it or hate it, many will turn their clocks back on Sunday. The debate — whether or not to make daylight saving time permanent — continues.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Trump threatens military action in Nigeria over Christian persecution claims
item.description: President Trump on Saturday said he's ordered the Pentagon to plan for potential military action in Nigeria, where he alleges the government is failing to rein in the persecution of Christians.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump on Saturday said he's ordered the Pentagon to plan for potential military action in Nigeria, where he alleges the government is failing to rein in the persecution of Christians.

(Image credit: Olamikan Gbemiga)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
